reviewText: I think developers could did it more precise, even with that game engine. I've just hit the car while parking and no points were taken from me, game only considers some area to activate success" trigger if your car touches this area. This is a good idea to give people some software to train their driving but I see laziness of developers in every aspect of this game."
voteText: 245 of 284 people (86%) found this review helpful 4 people found this review funny

reviewText:
Lets start with the pros:
The game had  a decent seletion of cars as well as buses and trucks
........?
Easy achievements if you are into them
.......?
Nudity?
Thats all I can think off

Now for a massive list of cons:
AI cars drive in surges, often braking suddenly causing you to hit them.
AI cars often drive 20-50kph below the speen limit.
AI cars often fail to follow road rules. Running red lights, hitting pedestrians, failing to give way.
AI cars never indicate.
AI cars will change into your lane regardlessif you are right next to them or not
Stop signs have absolutely no meaning in this game.
Except on the highway map, you can drive anywhere you want on the road (or on the side) as long as you dont cross the center if it is a solid line.
Cars are oversized for the roads, Buses barely fit.
City corners are square which is hard to turn a car around. Buses have to drive on the sidewalk.
Pedestrian crossing are randomly placed, usually with no lighting which makes nighttime driving pretty hazardous.
Pedestrians WILL cross the road regardless if you are too close to stop. They WILL walk into the side of a bus causing a penalty.
Lights at smaller intersection change rapidly and will cause you to lose points if you have not exited in time (buses nearly always lose points).
No cabin view, which is ok for cars, but makes driving a bus challenging.
Terrible mouse control for adjusting view. No options for quick change or centering. Need to fight to looking backwards.
Keyboard driving controls are terrible making driving on the highway map near impossible.
Low beam does nothing. High beam is nearly as good as you would expect from low beam. Limit cone width. Signs do not reflect the light until you are nearly on top of them. No penalty for driving with high beam all the time. no option to switch from high beam to low beam.
Sign visiblity is low so you barely have time to see a speed change and react.
Any Steam notifiactions pop up right over your speed, despite 2 corners having absolutley nothing in them.
There is more but I think you get the general idea.

For a driving game I would rate this 2/10
For a driving game that claims to educate, I am hesitant to give 1/10
BTW, I lied about the nudity so looks like that brings it to 0/10

reviewText:
The controls are terrible and the physics laughable. A pedestrian walked across the road and rolled a car over in a collision. Yes, pedestrians are stronger than cars in this game.

You can be merrily driving about, one tiny nudge to the left (that used to allign you correctly) makes you take a violent 50 degree turn into oncoming traffic. No reasons, only penalties. It also doesn't properly judge where traffic lights start, and why the heck you're forced to park in reverse is anyone's guess.

Whilst trying to park in reverse, I drove in and out of an entire building without any penalties. It was simply an illusion.

Put together as well as Big Rigs, but that at least lets you blast off into orbit. This game is just so poorly constructed, I can't even get a giggle out of its woeful assembly. I got this in a bundle, and that's about all it's worth.

reviewText:
At first after I played the Mobile version of the game, I thought that this would be just as fun, but what I was delivered was a terrible, unorganized, garbage, laggy game that took everything good out of the mobile version. It basically feels like you just made the detail higher and added a WASD control. Game controllers do NOT work correctly and the options menu and key changing menu is such a piece of garbage.

I wish I could get refunds back because I would in a heart beat. If you are going to release a god damn simulator, MAKE SURE IT EVEN SLIGHTLY WORKS AND HAS THE SIMULATION FEEL LIKE THE REST OF THE OTHER ONES!

I bet if you compared this game to Flight Simulator 2014, IGN would have rated it a 10/10 compared to this piece of garbage!

Take my advice and don't buy the game, I have every game the company made on my mobile device, and it's way better to just go get that version FOR FREE, FREE! Then spend the money you have on this piece of ♥♥♥♥ing ♥♥♥♥!

reviewText:
I think it has potential, it just needs to update and fix all the bugs and glitches. Yes it may be annoying, but don't forget, this game hasn't been in production for even a year so I think you should give it a chance.

Graphics-

They are okay, however it isn't 'stunning 3D graphics' as they say.
My computer isn't very high-end, but I can run it perfectly.
I would like to see hands on the wheel and realistic wheel rotation.
Graphics= 5/10

Gameplay-

It is a good game if you would like to chill out, it isn't frustrating.
You have a lot of different cars to choose from.
You can have a lot of different settings.
Gameplay= 7/10 (if it wasn't as buggy)

Overall, I would give this game a 6/10 because it is early access and is a fun game when it works.

reviewText:
Driving School Simulator does not work properly. If you have ANY controller plugged in, the keyboard will be locked out.

The hat-switch is intermittant, and you can't even look all the way around (as you would in real life).

The joystick controlls don't even work well. All I was able to do was turn on headlights.

Because the keyboard was locked out by the controller, I could not access the menu. I had to hit Alt F4 to quit.

I have uninstalled, and deleted this game.
